Recap: Dinah and Mallet try to have a real date, but end up back in bed together. Frank finds out some information on Gus and lets Harley know but tells her to take her family on vacation like she planned. Frank calls Mallet to get to the crash site and when he jumps in the shower Dinah inadvertently tells her about the news at the crash site. Harley turns the jet around and meets up with Mallet at the crash site where they find his bloody coat and his wedding ring. Sandy spies on Jonathan and Tammy and when Jonathan calls her on it, he tells them he is moving out west. Later while Tammy is away, Sandy tells Jonathan that he is closing on the house "just in case". He also rubs in that it was his doing that got Tammy back into school and lets Jonathan know that he has a job in the office. Reva questions Jeffrey if he was ever playing Richard while with her and he tells her that his time was later than when Reva was there. He jokingly tells her that she can't blame Jonathan on him. He remembers a time though that he had sex with Cassie while she was intoxicated. Josh gets a hold of a high school friend whose agency is the one that Jeffrey worked for. He tells Cassie that the information she is wanting about Jeffrey is classified, but she tells him that by being a member of the royal family she can insist on the information and demands it of him.
Transcript: Dinah: What do we drink to next?
Mallet: Let's drink to your jeans.
Dinah: We already drank to that.
Mallet: All right, well let's drink to you with no jeans.
Dinah: Okay.
Mallet: I'm sorry, I know. I promised.
Dinah: Come on. A normal night out. Date. Dinner, movie.
Mallet: Can I let you in on a secret? Normal is so overrated.
Dinah: Well you know what? Normal is normal to me. That's not abnormal, which is a good thing.
Mallet: That's kind of deep.
Dinah: Look, just...

Mallet: I know what you mean. I know you mean. You're just way past normal. And I think the stuff you've been doing lately with Harley and helping her out, just kind of makes me proud. Does that sound weird?
Dinah: ( Laughs ) Yeah, kind of.
Mallet: How about let's get out of here?
Dinah: Okay, okay, yeah, that's good. We had had our dinner, and now we're on to the movie, but...
Mallet: Cuddle, cuddle. Fuzzy, fuzzy.
Dinah: No sex. No sex, come on, you promised. We're going to have a normal date, a normal night out. We have to behave, Mallet.
Mallet: I hate those two little words "behave."

Zach: Mommy, is Gus going to meet us in Hawaii?

Harley: I'm fine. I'm fine. I just remembered I left all your dvds on the tarmac. I'll be right back.

Frank: You guys, listen, I need your help.

Jonathan: How nice of you.

Jeffrey: ( Laughs ) Yeah. Yeah, I wore the outfit, right down to the sash. That was part of the job, protecting him, keeping Richard safe.
Reva: Keeping up public appearances?
Jeffrey: Public appearances, speeches, openings, wherever he had a chance of catching a bullet.

Jeffrey: No. She's going to work this out. She's pulling away from me right now.
Reva: Yeah, I guess she just needs some time.

Reva: I just have to ask: When you were playing Richard, did you ever play him with me?

Dinah: I'm loving the movie. I've seen this ten times; I can tell you every scene.

Dinah: Uh-huh. Of course it's a mermaid. ( Screams ) You can't kiss me.

Jeffrey: Richard Winslow had everything any man could ever want, and more.

Ricky Paul Golden, inside "The Light". I have ADD, I'm a perfectionist, and maybe too much where it really drives everybody crazy. Beth Ellers, she is the best sparring partner I've ever had. From the bottom of my heart, I thank you. See Gus February 1st, inside "The Light".
